dimred.pathsample_wrapper¶

Wrapper to PATHSAMPLE implementation of graph transformation¶

This module provides a Python interface for the graph transformation implementation in the PATHSAMPLE program available under the GNU General Public License. In addition to constructing a discrete-state network-representation of the energy landscape, the PATHSAMPLE program provides tools to compute rates and mean first passage times between product and reactant regions on the landscape.

The program also includes a REGROUPFREE routine, which groups together potential energy or free energy minimuma separated by low-lying barriers within a free energy regrouping threshold. This routine can be used to pre-process a network by lumping together rapidly interconverting states.

The implementation of graph transformation in Fortran is preferrable for large networks on the order of 100,000 nodes. For smaller networks, the python implementation available in graph_tran.gt_tools should suffice.

  • Used the ParsedPathsample class to read in the initial pathdata file, which specifies the input keyworks for the PATHSAMPLE program. Modify the input parameters as desired using this class.
  • Use the ScanPathsample class to run calculations with PATHSAMPLE and parse output files to obtain the desired quantities (i.e. rate constants, mean first passage times, groups identified by REGROUPFREE, etc.)
class graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.ParsedPathsample(pathdata, outfile=None)[source]¶

Class to parse input keywords and output files utilized by the PATHSAMPLE program. To initialize a ParsedPathsample object, supply the constructor with the pathdata argument, which should include a full path to the pathdata file.

path¶

Path object – path to directory containing all relevant input files, including pathdata file, which specifies input keywords.

input¶

dict – dictionary containing PATHSAMPLE keywords and their values

output¶

dict – dictionary mapping observables to their values parsed from PATHSAMPLE output files.

numInA¶

int – Number of minima in A.

numInB¶

int – Number of minima in B.

minA¶

list – IDs of minima in A set (0-indexed)

minB¶

list – IDs of minima in B set (0-indexed)

append_input(name, value)[source]¶

Add a new keyword or update an existing keyword to the PATHSAMPLE input.

comment_input(name)[source]¶

Delete a keyword from pathdata file.

define_A_and_B(numInA, numInB, sorted=True, mindata=None)[source]¶

Define an A and B set as a function of the number of minima in A and B based on their energies.

draw_disconnectivity_graph_AB(value, temp)[source]¶

Draw a Disconnectivity Graph colored by the minima in A and B after running REGROUPFREE at threshold value and temperature temp.

parse_GT_intermediates(outfile)[source]¶

Returns a pandas DataFrame of GT quantities, including branching probabilities and MFPTs from individual source nodes, after disconnection of sources.

parse_dumpgroups(mingroupsfile, grouptomin=False)[source]¶

Parse the minima_groups.{temp} file outputted by the DUMPGROUPS keyword in PATHSAMPLE. Returns a dictionary mapping minID to groupID (if grouptomin is False), or a dirctionary mapping groupID to minID (if grouptomin is True). Both IDs are 1-indexed.

parse_input(pathdatafile)[source]¶

Store keywords in pathdata file as a dictionary mapping to values, which are read in as strings.

parse_minA_and_minB(minA, minB)[source]¶

Read in the number of minima and the minima IDs in the A and B sets from the min.A and min.B files and set the self.minA, self.numInA, self.minB and self.numInB attributes. Note, minima IDs in these files correspond to line numbers in min.data which are (1-indexed).

Parameters:
  • minA (str or Path object) – full path to min.A file
  • minB (str or Path object) – full path to min.B file
parse_output(outfile)[source]¶

Parses PATHSAMPLE output for key quantities printed out by the NGT and WAITPDF subroutines, namely Temperature, kSS, kNSS, kF, and MFPTs for the A->B and B->A directions. Stores quantities in self.output.

sort_A_and_B(minA, minB, mindata)[source]¶

Sort the minima in min.A and min.B according to their energies.

write_input(pathdatafile)[source]¶

Writes out a valid pathdata file based on keywords in self.input

write_minA_minB(minA, minB)[source]¶

Write a min.A and min.B file based on minIDs specified in self.minA and self.minB.

class graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.ScanPathsample(pathdata, outbase=None, suffix='')[source]¶

Interface to run the REGROUPFREE, DUMPINFOMAP, NGT, and WAITPDF subroutines of the PATHSAMPLE program. Uses the ParsedPathsample class to control input parameters and and parse output.

pathdatafile¶

str or Path object – full path to pathdata file, which stores input keywords for the PATHSAMPLE program.

parse¶

ParsedPathsample object – stores input and output of PATHSAMPLE runs.

path¶

Path object – full path to directory containing all input and output files.

suffix¶

str – suffix of rates_{suffix}.csv file. Defaults to ‘’

outbase¶

str – prefix for PATHSAMPLE output files. Defaults to ‘out’

calc_inter_community_rates_GT(C1, C2, communities)[source]¶

Calculate k_{C1<-C2} using GT. Here, C1 and C2 are community IDs (i.e. groups identified in DUMPGROUPS file from REGROUPFREE). This function isolates the minima in C1 union C2 and the transition states that connect them and feeds this subnetwork into PATHSAMPLE, using the NGT keyword to calculate inter-community rates.

dump_rates_from_local_equilibrium_approx(temp)[source]¶

Dump rate matrix and stationary probabilities of the coarse-grained network resulting from the REGROUPFREE routine run at temperature temp. Writes out ts_conns.dat, ts_weights.dat, and stat_prob.dat files representing the regrouped network.

dump_rates_full_network(temp=None)[source]¶

Dump rate matrix and stationary probabilities calculated in the PATHSAMPLE setup using the DUMP_INFOMAP keyword. Writes out ts_conns.dat, ts_weights.dat, and stat_prob.dat files.

Note

Make sure that any existing stat_prob.dat, ts_conns.dat, and ts_weights.dat files are deleted from the self.path directory.

get_MFPTAB_PATHSAMPLE(A, B, communities, temp, n)[source]¶

Run a single GT calculation using the READRATES keyword in PATHSAMPLE to get the A<->B mean first passage time at specified temperature.

Parameters:
  • A (int) – community ID (0-indexed) of A set.
  • B (int) – community ID (0-indexed) of B set.
  • communities (dict) – dictionary mapping community IDs (1-indexed) to node IDs (1-indexed).
  • temp (float) – temperature at which to run PATHSAMPLE calculations.
  • n (int) – number of nodes, needed for READRATES keyword.
Returns:

  • MFPTAB (float) – Mean first passage time A <- B
  • MFPTBA (float) – Mean first passage time B <- A
get_intercommunity_MFPTs_GT_PATHSAMPLE(temp, communities)[source]¶

Use PATHSAMPLE to compute the matrix of true MFPTs between communities.

Parameters:
  • temp (float) – Temperature at which to calculate inter-community MFPTs.
  • communities (dict) – dictionary mapping community IDs (1-indexed) to node IDs (1-indexed).
Returns:

MFPT – matrix of inter-community MFPTs computed with PATHSAMPLE
Return type:

np.ndarray[float64] (ncomms, ncomms)
get_intermicrostate_mfpts_GT_PATHSAMPLE(n=None)[source]¶

Use PATHSAMPLE to compute the matrix of inter-microstate MFPTs between all pairs of the n nodes at the specified temperature temp.

Parameters:
  • temp (float) – Temperature at which to run GT calculations.
  • n (int) – Number of nodes.
Returns:

mfpt – Matrix of inter-minima MFPTs.
Return type:

np.ndarray[float64] (n,n)
remove_output()[source]¶

Delete PATHSAMPLE log files.

run_NGT_exact(temp)[source]¶

Run a single GT calculation using the PATHSAMPLE program at the specified temperature temp with inputs specified by the self.parse class.

run_NGT_regrouped(Gthresh, temp)[source]¶

After running REGROUPFREE at threshold Gthresh and temperature temp, calculate rates using NGT on regrouped minima.

Parameters:
  • Gthresh (float) – Free energy regrouping threshold used by REGROUPFREE.
  • temp (float) – Temperature.
Returns:

rates – dictionary of NGT output quantities, including MFPT, kF, kSS, and kNSS for the A<-B and B<-A directions.
Return type:

dict
run_regroup(temp, value, NGTpostregroup=False)[source]¶

Run REGROUPFREE once at a threshold given by value and a temperature given by temp

Parameters:
  • temp (float) – Temperature.
  • value (float) – Free energy regrouping threshold for REGROUPFREE.
  • NGTpostregroup (bool) – If True, a single GT calculation is run on the regrouped network. Defaults to False.
Returns:

df – single row with columns temp, Gthresh, and rates computed on regrouped network
Return type:

pandas DataFrame
scan_regroup(values, temp, NGTpostregroup=False)[source]¶

Run the REGROUPFREE routine for a range of regrouping thresholds. Calculate A<->B rates on regrouped networks and original network and save to a csv file.

Parameters:
  • values (array-like) – Free energy regrouping thresholds.
  • temp (float) – Temperature.
  • NGTpostregroup (bool) – If True, a single GT calculation is run on each regrouped network. Defaults to False.
scan_temp(values, name='TEMPERATURE')[source]¶

Run PATHSAMPLE over a range of temperatures specified by values and extract rates from the NGT keyword output which are written to a csv file. This function can also be used to scan any other single keyword by specifying the name and a range of values.

graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.dump_ktn_info_scan(path, temps, nrgthreshs=None)[source]¶

Dump stat_prob.dat, ts_conns.dat, and ts_weights.dat files for each temperature in temps, and one communites.dat file for each (temperature, Gthresh) pair.

Parameters:
  • temps (array-like) – Temperatures at which to dump rate matrix and stationary probabilities with DUMPINFO keyword.
  • nrgthreshs (array-like) – Free energy regrouping thresholds used for previous runs of REGROUPFREE. Defaults to None.
graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.scan_Gthresh_and_temp(temps, nrgthreshs)[source]¶

Calculate rates at different free energy regrouping thresholds and at different temperatures.

graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.scan_product_states(numinAs, numinBs, temps)[source]¶

Calculate rates using NGT for various definitions of A and B sets.

graph_tran.dimred.pathsample_wrapper.write_communities(self, communities, commdat)[source]¶

Write a single-column file commdat where each line is the community ID (zero-indexed) of the minima given by the line number.

Parameters:
  • communities (dict) – mapping from minima ID (1-indexed) to community ID (1-indexed)
  • commdat (dat file name) – full path to file to which to write communitiy assignments (0-indexed)
